result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Guadalupe Mendieta

records.addlTxt:
Asst. District Attorney Kari Hoffman appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Trisha Janet Fritz and Jose Guadalupe Mendieta appear in custody, via Zoom. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Assistant District Attorney Ryan Spaude appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Trisha Janet Fritz and Jose Guadalupe Mendieta appear in custody, via Zoom. Defendant pleads not guilty. Present bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jose Guadalupe Mendieta in court, in custody at Brown County Jail.  Attorney Trisha Janet Fritz in court for Jose Guadalupe Mendieta.  Prosecuting attorney J. Foss Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Court accepts waiver and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jose Guadalupe Mendieta appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Trisha Janet Fritz appeared by video for Jose Guadalupe Mendieta.  
Prosecuting attorney Kevin L Steuck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Present bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Present bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety. 
Defendant to report to CJS within 24 hours of court or release from custody.

Prosecuting attorney Natalie M. Mulvey appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jose Guadalupe Mendieta appeared by video, in custody. Attorney K. Martin appeared, via zoom, on behalf of the defendant.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
